thread.title: Telescope's first foal arrives at Shade Oak Stud
thread.title_full: Telescope's first foal arrives at Shade Oak Stud

title: Telescope's first foal arrives at Shade Oak Stud

organizations.name: shade oak stud arrival of telescope

text:
Arrival of Telescope's first foal at Shade Oak Stud out of Lina Gram PICTURE: RP GRAPHICS Telescope's first foal arrives at Shade Oak By Ollie O'Donoghue 2:13PM 10 JAN 2017 
THE first foal by top-class middle-distance runner Telescope was born at ten minutes to midnight on Monday at Shade Oak Stud in Shropshire. 
The bay colt is out of Lina Gram , a runner-up in a bumper at Hexham on debut and a daughter of St Leger and Ascot Gold Cup winner Classic Cliche. 
Peter Hockenhull, owner of Shade Oak Stud, said: "I have been looking forward to Telescope's first foals with tremendous anticipation, hoping that they inherit the fantastic looks of their sire; and this one is simply stunning. 
"He is a big, strong bay colt with great bone, a 'ten out of ten' for me. If the others turn out as good then Telescope will be off to a wonderful start as a sire."
